title: Five European countries say Russia 'poisoned' Putin critic Alexei Navalny in prison
subhead: 'The UK, Sweden, France, Germany and The Netherlands are confident that Alexei Navalny was poisoned with a lethal toxin,' the countries said in a joint statement on the sidelines of the Munich Security Conference on Saturday.

title: In Munich, France and Germany present two visions for Europe while Rubio wants to 'build a new Western century'
Louvre Museum hit by flooding as misfortunes continue to mount
Macron condemns France's 'antisemitic hydra,' which 'continues to grow'
subhead: Twenty years to the day after the premeditated murder of a young Jewish man, the French president delivered a speech on Friday expressing his desire to see the introduction of 'mandatory ineligibility' for elected officials convicted of 'antisemitic, racist and discriminatory acts and remarks.'

title: Marseille mayoral election: Who's running?
subhead: Six main candidates are vying to win the mayoralty in the Mediterranean city of Marseille, in the municipal elections on March 15 and 22.

title: Victoires de la Musique 2026: French-Congolese pop star Theodora cements her status
subhead: The breakout pop phenomenon of 2025, the French-Congolese artist won the awards for Female Newcomer, Live Newcomer, Album of the Year and Music Video of the Year at France's annual music awards ceremony. Charlotte Cardin and Disiz were named Female and Male Artist of the Year, respectively.

title: Mika opens the doors to his Tuscany villa: 'Throw us anywhere, and we'll make poetry'
subhead: The singer chaired the 41st edition of the Victoires de la Musique, France's annual music awards ceremony, on Friday, following the late January release of his seventh album, 'Hyperlove.' Currently on tour, he will perform in Paris on Monday.

Why are major powers competing for control of the Arctic?
subhead: The Arctic has become a strategic focal point for countries, lying at the intersection of climate and geopolitical challenges. Climate change has sharply accelerated this transformation.

title: France's demographics debate focuses on birth rates while ignoring touchier measures
subhead: Politicians have struggled to address the various aspects of France's current demographic shift. The debate on the issue remains focused on boosting birth rates, while steering clear of more sensitive topics such as immigration or the retirement age.

title: 'The decline in birth rates is a social phenomenon, not a woman's responsibility'
subhead: Instead of questioning the collective factors behind declining birth rates, the dominant narrative shifts responsibility onto women, laments Brigitte Grésy, former president of France's High Council for Gender Equality, and Micheline Misrahi-Abadou, professor at the faculty of medicine of Paris-Saclay University.

title: The French right faces an existential challenge
A balanced choice on energy despite populist pressures
French police's interactions with youth is a question of security and equality
